speaker: Clara
text: We should have simplified the onboarding flow. Users clearly got stuck on the first screen.
ipa: wi ʃʊd həv ˈsɪmpləˌfaɪd ði ˈɑnbɔɹdɪŋ floʊ. ˈjuzɚz ˈklɪɹli ɡɑt stʌk ɑn ðə fɝst skɹin.
stress: We SHOULD have SIMPLIFIED the ONBOARDING FLOW. USERS clearly got STUCK on the FIRST SCREEN.
linking:
"should have" → /ʃʊd həv/ (d + h linking)
"got stuck" → /ɡɑt stʌk/ (t + s linking)

speaker: Ben
text: Yeah… We might have confused them by adding too many form fields upfront.
ipa: jæ… wi maɪt həv kənˈfjuzd ðɛm baɪ ˈædɪŋ tu ˈmɛni fɔɹm fildz ʌpˈfɹʌnt.
stress: Yeah… We MIGHT have CONFUSED them by ADDING too MANY FORM FIELDS UPFRONT.
linking:
"might have" → /maɪt həv/ (t + h linking)
"form fields" → /fɔɹm fildz/ (m + f linking)

speaker: Clara
text: And I could have removed the optional steps entirely. They weren’t really necessary.
ipa: ænd aɪ kʊd həv ɹɪˈmuːvd ði ˈɑpʃənəl stɛps ɪnˈtaɪɹli. ðeɪ ˈwɝnt ˈɹɪli ˈnɛsəˌsɛɹi.
stress: And I COULD have REMOVED the OPTIONAL STEPS ENTIRELY. They WEREN’T really NECESSARY.
linking:
"could have" → /kʊd həv/ (d + h linking)
"optional steps" → /ˈɑpʃənəl stɛps/ (l + s linking)

speaker: Ben
text: To be honest, we shouldn’t have skipped that user testing session last week.
ipa: tu bi ˈɑnəst, wi ˈʃʊdənt həv skɪpt ðæt ˈjuzɚ ˈtɛstɪŋ ˈsɛʃən læst wik.
stress: To be HONEST, we SHOULDN’T have SKIPPED that USER TESTING SESSION last WEEK.
linking:
"shouldn’t have" → /ˈʃʊdənt həv/ (t + h linking)
"skipped that" → /skɪpt ðæt/ (t + th linking)

speaker: Clara
text: Definitely. Product must have assumed it was fine without checking with us.
ipa: ˈdɛfənətli. ˈpɹɑdəkt mʌst həv əˈsumd ɪt wəz faɪn wɪˈðaʊt ˈtʃɛkɪŋ wɪð ʌs.
stress: DEFINITELY. PRODUCT must have ASSUMED it was FINE without CHECKING with US.
linking:
"must have" → /mʌst həv/ (t + h linking)
"checking with" → /ˈtʃɛkɪŋ wɪð/ (g + w linking)

speaker: Ben
text: Still, we could have flagged the complexity earlier during sprint planning.
ipa: stɪl, wi kʊd həv flæɡd ðə kəmˈplɛksəti ˈɝliɚ ˈdjʊɹɪŋ spɹɪnt ˈplænɪŋ.
stress: STILL, we COULD have FLAGGED the COMPLEXITY EARLIER during SPRINT PLANNING.
linking:
"could have" → /kʊd həv/ (d + h linking)
"flagged the" → /flæɡd ðə/ (d + th linking)

speaker: Clara
text: Yeah… and I should have trusted my instinct when I felt something was off with the UX.
ipa: jæ… ænd aɪ ʃʊd həv ˈtɹʌstɪd maɪ ˈɪnstɪŋkt wɛn aɪ fɛlt ˈsʌmθɪŋ wəz ɔf wɪð ðə ˌjuːˈɛks.
stress: Yeah… and I SHOULD have TRUSTED my INSTINCT when I FELT something was OFF with the UX.
linking:
"should have" → /ʃʊd həv/ (d + h linking)
"trusted my" → /ˈtɹʌstɪd maɪ/ (d + m linking)
